sentences: Georges Laurent (7 June 1886 – 22 September 1964) was a 20th-century French flautist.
He then studied privately with Philippe Gaubert in 1897, before entering the Conservatoire de Paris (1902) where he worked with Paul Taffanel and obtained the First Prize in 1905.
He taught as soon as 1923 at the New England Conservatory of Music, where Claude Monteux and Robert Hugh Willoughby were among his pupils.
Bohuslav Martinů dedicated him his flute sonata H. 306 (1945) and Daniel Gregory Mason, his opus 13: 3 Pieces for flute, harp and string quartet (circa 1911–12, publ. 1923).
